pageContext.description: Slightly bowed faces in cross-section with good body angles, in parts with minimal concavity inside, but no flanging at all: sides probably were rounded; orig. butt shape uncertain,Manufacture: steep e. bev. - but line now rounded, bevel a little recurved at one end.,Condition: e.v. sharp but conceivably from recent cleaning; one blade tip a little squashed - bright gold; nick in edge assoc. with corrosion; butt in profile obliquely faceted -  smooth and slightly brighter - certainly modern
pageContext.surface: Mainly dull gold-brown [...] mini-pocked surface, some brighter gold-flocking; few darker green-brown patches - likely remnant base of patina; some deeper pocks assoc. with light green and fir green corr.
pageContext.other: Top left of card contains "c. TQ 377", and aligned under the "377", "393". I'm not sure if this is a grid reference. Although the Site doesn't say "25 North End", but just "North End", the circumstances mention that specific address. I wasn't sure whether to enter that info. in the Site address. The Site didn't say "England" either, but I have added that because I have seen it done that way on most other cards. I transcribed Context into Associations. Note - I haven't always included the  Context code as well as the words on some previous cards - sorry. I transcribed Typology, Manufacture, Condition into Description. I transcribed Surface into Surface, but I think some of it may relate to patina. I transcribed the Metallurgy - Analyst bit (I assume BM Res. Lab. stands for British Museum Research Laboratory)   into Composition. (I put this bit in in Remarks on an earlier card, but Composition seems more appropriate). Boxes at bottom right of card contains some info: Rec. "SN .Feb '81", Sub.Inf. "Miss Chewter 27/10/80 (& Fiona Marsden, Lewes)", unlabelled box "RSO 27/10/80", Source "Sb.A.". There are also ticks in boxes labelled PIF, DF, SI and CI.,  PS do we transcribers ever get any feedback if we are doing it all wrong?
pageContext.composition: Metallurgy - Analyst BM Res. Lab. BBA 687
pageContext.collection: CHEWTER, Miss Karen - private, 38 Halsford Green, East Grinstead, West Sussex
pageContext.site: England, sussex (west), east grinstead,north end,circumstances: found june-july 1978 while "double digging" in the back garden of 25 north end, east grinstead; approximately in the middle of the garde, and brought up from a maximum depth of c. 18"; the axe was spotted by karen chewter after having been dug out by mr. chewter, her father.
